channel.title: How to Access a Server Running in a VirtualBox Guest :: Salix Documentation
channel.description: VirtualBox guests are usually set up with NAT networking. That way, there is no way to directly access a server running in a VirtualBox guest from the host system or from anywhere in the network. In order to do that, youâ€™ll have to inform VirtualBox to forward packets from a host port to a port in the guest system. This guide will show you how to access an ssh server running in a VirtualBox guest, but the procedure is similar for any kind of server that you may want to run (ftp, apache http etc).
